section.note: In the samples below, :SRID indicates the optional spatial reference identifier argument. For SQL Server, the default is 4326.

section.title: Creating and Dropping Tables with Geometry Columns

case.title: Creating
case.example: CREATE TABLE GeogTest ( KeyValue varchar(25) NOT NULL, Location Geography NOT NULL, PRIMARY KEY (KeyValue))

case.title: Portable
case.example: INSERT INTO GeogTest (KeyValue, Location) values('Item1', GeogCreateLocation(-70, 42, :SRID))

case.title: Native
case.example: INSERT INTO GeogTest (KeyValue, Location) VALUES ('Item1', geography::Point(42, - 70, :SRID))

case.title: Portable
case.example: INSERT INTO GeogTest (KeyValue, Location) values('Item2', GeogCreateLine(-70, 42, -70, 38, :SRID))

case.title: Native
case.example: INSERT INTO GeogTest (KeyValue, Location) VALUES ('Item2', geography::STGeomFromText('LINESTRING(' + CAST( - 70 as Varchar(max)) + ' ' + CAST(42 as Varchar(max)) + ', ' + CAST( - 70 as Varchar(max)) + ' ' + CAST(38 as Varchar(max)) + ')', :SRID))

case.title: Portable
case.example: INSERT INTO GeogTest (KeyValue, Location) values('Item3', GeogCreatePolygon(-70, 42, -70, 32, -60, 32, -60, 42, -70, 42, :SRID))

case.title: Native
case.example: INSERT INTO GeogTest (KeyValue, Location) VALUES ('Item3', geography::STGeomFromText('POLYGON((' + CAST( - 70 as Varchar(max)) + ' ' + CAST(42 as Varchar(max)) + ', ' + CAST( - 70 as Varchar(max)) + ' ' + CAST(32 as Varchar(max)) + ', ' + CAST( - 60 as Varchar(max)) + ' ' + CAST(32 as Varchar(max)) + ', ' + CAST( - 60 as Varchar(max)) + ' ' + CAST(42 as Varchar(max)) + ', ' + CAST( - 70 as Varchar(max)) + ' ' + CAST(42 as Varchar(max)) + '))', :SRID))

see.ref: Changes to SQL Objects for Geometry
